messages.content: It is exam week now, and today is January 16, 2025.  Check the announcements in Canvas for information and compile a list of the remaining final exams I need to take. Please fill in the table `exam_schedule.xlsx` directly under the workspace; the column names have already been provided, do not change the file name after filling in it.  Remove the “-x” suffix from course codes and course names.  Do not include courses that have already ended, that I do not need to attend, or that explicitly state there is no final exam.  The table must list all courses that have not yet ended, that I need to take, and that do not explicitly state there is no final exam. By default, the proctor is the course instructor. If any exam information has not yet been released, mark the cell as TBD. When filling in the table, completely preserve the original table headers.

    "message": "Dear CS101-3 students,\n\n🚀 Group Project has been announced!\n\n👥 Team Size: 3-4 students\n📅 Project Due: December 15, 2024\n📊 Weight: 25% of final grade\n\n🎯 Project Options:\n1. Web application development\n2. Data analysis and visualization\n3. Machine learning implementation\n4.     "subscription_hold": "topic_is_announcement"
  },

    "message": "Dear MATH201-3 students,\n\n📊 Individual Research Project Announced!\n\n📅 Due Date: December 12, 2024\n📊 Weight: 20% of final grade\n\n🎯 Project Requirements:\n- Choose a mathematical topic related to course material\n- Write a 8-10 page research paper\n- Include mathematical proofs or applications\n- Present findings to the class (10 minutes)\n\n📋 Suggested Topics:\n- Applications of linear algebra in computer graphics\n- Mathematical modeling in real-world problems\n- Historical development of key theorems\n- Computational methods and algorithms\n\n📅 Timeline:\n- Topic selection: November 15, 2024\n- Outline submission: November 25, 2024\n- Draft for peer review: December 5, 2024\n- Final submission: December 12, 2024\n\nBest regards,\nCourse Instructor",

    "message": "Dear MATH101-3 students,\n\n📊 Individual Research Project Announced!\n\n📅 Due Date: December 12, 2024\n📊 Weight: 20% of final grade\n\n🎯 Project Requirements:\n- Choose a mathematical topic related to course material\n- Write a 8-10 page research paper\n- Include mathematical proofs or applications\n- Present findings to the class (10 minutes)\n\n📋 Suggested Topics:\n- Applications of linear algebra in computer graphics\n- Mathematical modeling in real-world problems\n- Historical development of key theorems\n- Computational methods and algorithms\n\n📅 Timeline:\n- Topic selection: November 15, 2024\n- Outline submission: November 25, 2024\n- Draft for peer review: December 5, 2024\n- Final submission: December 12, 2024\n\nBest regards,\nCourse Instructor",

- CS301 Database Systems: Proctor changed to Professor Smith; date/time/duration/location TBD
- CS302 Software Engineering Practice: 01/17/2025 09:00, 120 min, Building C Room 305, Closed Book
- CS401 Software Engineering: 01/17/2025 14:00, 180 min, Building C Room 301, Closed Book
- AI101 Fundamentals of Artificial Intelligence: 01/18/2025 09:00, 120 min, Building A Room 201, Closed Book
- DB101 Database Systems Fundamentals: exam details TBD

- MATH201 Advanced Mathematics: 01/20/2025 09:00, 150 min, Building B Room 301, Open Book
